alert.note: Alert for Wheeler (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 03 at 2:00PM CDT until June 07 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Texas... Sweetwater Creek at Kelton 5N affecting Wheeler County. For the Sweetwater Creek...including Kelton 5N...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Sweetwater Creek at Kelton 5N. * WHEN...Until Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Water overflows both banks. Cattle in flood plain are threatened and should have easy access to higher ground. At 18.0 feet, Flood stage. The south approach to bridge along highway 592 begins to flood. The road that leads to Britt Ranch just downstream of gage site begins to flood. Widespread flooding of ranch and farm land occurs. Cattle and farm equipment losses are possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 11.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 16.1 feet tomorrow evening. - Action stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 200 AM CDT.
